questions.question: Which of the following is the most effective single intervention for fall prevention in elderly patients?

answers.text: Exercise programs focusing on balance and strength

questions.feedback: Multi-component exercise programs have the strongest evidence for reducing fall risk (30-40% reduction).

questions.question: What is the recommended daily vitamin D dose for fall prevention in elderly patients?
questions.feedback: 800-1000 IU daily is recommended for fall prevention in elderly patients with vitamin D deficiency.

questions.question: Which medication class is most associated with increased fall risk?
questions.feedback: Benzodiazepines increase fall risk by 40-60% due to sedation and impaired balance.

flashcards.back: Drop of ≥20 mmHg systolic or ≥10 mmHg diastolic within 3 minutes of standing
